capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Requires clear communication with Aboriginal Joint Management Committees and external stakeholders to support liaison and deliver on commitments.

capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: Essential for establishing and managing joint management committees and collaborating with key stakeholders.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: Necessary for managing multiple tasks, including executive administrative support, program implementation, and project advancement.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: Important for developing practical solutions to advance joint management objectives and assist in the delivery of culturally relevant educational and tourism activities.

capabilities.name: Value Diversity
capabilities.description: Critical for respecting and working closely with Traditional Owners and valuing connection to Country.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: Responsible for adhering to memorandum of understanding agreements, Indigenous Land Use Agreements, and reserve plans of management.

capabilities.name: Manage Reform and Change
capabilities.description: Support and promote change in management practices to better incorporate Aboriginal heritage and cultural knowledge.

skills.name: Executive Administrative Support
skills.description: Providing a wide range of executive administrative services to support the liaison between NPWS and Aboriginal Joint Management Committees.

skills.name: Stakeholder Collaboration
skills.description: Collaborating with key stakeholders to establish and manage joint management committees and deliver on NPWS commitments.

skills.name: Cultural Knowledge
skills.description: Understanding and respecting Aboriginal culture and heritage, essential for working effectively in this role.

generalRole.title: Aboriginal Joint Management Coordinator
generalRole.description: This role involves coordinating with Aboriginal Joint Management Committees to conserve and protect Aboriginal heritage and the natural environment, requiring a blend of administrative, project delivery, and environmental science skills, with a strong emphasis on cultural knowledge and collaboration.
